meanings.definition: The state or quality of being decadent.
meanings.sent1: The decadency of the old mansion was evident in its faded grandeur.
meanings.sent2: The decadency of the city was marked by its crumbling infrastructure.
meanings.sent3: The decadency of the cake was evident in its overly sweet frosting.
meanings.sent4: The decadency of the once vibrant neighborhood was now a shadow of its former self.
meanings.sent5: The decadency of the empire was a stark reminder of its former glory.

meanings.definition: A period of decline or decay.
meanings.sent1: After years of prosperity, the town faced a period of decadency.
meanings.sent2: The decadency of the ancient ruins was a testament to the passage of time.
meanings.sent3: The decadency of the garden in winter gave hope for its revival in spring.
meanings.sent4: The decadency of the once bustling market signaled a shift in the economy.
meanings.sent5: The decadency of the old book was a reflection of neglect over time.

meanings.definition: Excessive indulgence in luxury or pleasure.
meanings.sent1: The decadency of the feast left everyone feeling uncomfortably full.
meanings.sent2: Her decadency in shopping led to a closet overflowing with clothes.
meanings.sent3: The decadency of the spa day was a treat she rarely allowed herself.
meanings.sent4: His decadency in desserts knew no bounds, leading to frequent trips to the bakery.
meanings.sent5: The decadency of the vacation was a welcome break from the daily routine.
